attributes.action: Ensure that victims' rights no longer remain subordinate to those of their perpetrators.  Victims demand equal rights, support and welfare.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There are over 100 fully funded organisations supporting prisoners, ex-offenders and prisoners' families.  Whilst victims' groups consider this is acceptable, Penal Reform organisations outnumber victims organisations 100-1.
For every £28,000 spent anually on each prisoner's welfare, safety, rehabilitation, legal aid and quality of life, only £18.66 is spent on each victim.
Penal Reform organisations have been established since 1876.  Conversely, the first victims' organisation emerged 100 years later, in 1976, and later victim-led organisations emerged during the 1990's.
Criminology is a well researched, funded and academic subject, whereas victimology is almost considered to be a 'brand new science';largely ignored as less significant by society as criminology.
